required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of CF101 to Treat Keratoconjunctivitis Sicca
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Masked, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Daily CF101 Administered Orally in Patients With Moderate-to-Severe Keratoconjunctivitis Sicca

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 2, randomized, double-masked, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study in adult males and females, aged 18 years and over, with a diagnosis of moderate-to-severe keratoconjunctivitis sicca (KCS). Patients will be randomized to receive either CF101 1 mg or matching placebo, given orally every 12 hours (q12h) for 12 weeks. A Screening Period of up to 4 weeks that includes a 2-week run-in period will precede a 12-week treatment period, followed by a 2-week follow-up period.

detailed_description.textblock:
At a Screening Visit, patients who provide written informed consent will have screening procedures performed, including a complete medical history, medication history, physical examination, including height, weight, sitting blood pressure, pulse rate and temperature, and clinical laboratory tests. Disease activity will be assessed using tear meniscus (TM) height, tear break-up time (BUT), fluorescein staining (FS), Schirmer test, and the Dry Eye Symptom Score (DESS). Doses of artificial tears must be stable for >2 weeks prior to the Screening Visit.
Eligible patients will begin a 2-week run-in period, during which time they will be instructed to discontinue use of all topical ophthalmic medications except for lubricant eye drops. Patients who successfully complete the 2-week run-in period will be randomized to their assigned medication (CF101 1 mg or matching placebo) to be taken orally every q12h for 12 weeks. Patients will return for assessments and a new supply of study medication at Weeks 2, 4, 8 and 12, and at Week 14 for a final follow-up assessment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: involved placing a standardized paper tear strip inside the lower eyelid for 5 minutes. The tear strip was then removed and the length of the strip that was wet from tears was measured in millimeters
time elapsed between a complete blink and the development of the first random dry spot on the tear film

Severity of corneal epithelial loss as graded by Fluorescein Staining of the cornea, assessed on a 0-4+ scale with 0 = none and 4+ = severe de-epithelialization, expressed as number of participants with >25% improvement at Week 12 relative to baseline

secondary_outcome.description: improvement of ≥25% over baseline at Week 12 in BUT, superficial punctate keratitis as assessed by FS, or ST
consists of 12 questions designed to assess the symptoms of ocular irritations, covering three areas: ocular symptoms, environmental triggers and visionrelated function
Indicator of tear volume. TM was recorded on a scale from 0-3, with 0=none, 1=trace, 2=normal, and 3=high.
daily use of REFRESH TEARS® Lubricant Eye Drops artificial tears supplied to each patient was recorded in diaries provided to patients

arm_group.description: CF101 1 mg given orally every 12 hours for 12 weeks
Placebo given orally every 12 hours for 12 weeks

results_reference.citation: Avni I, Garzozi HJ, Barequet IS, Segev F, Varssano D, Sartani G, Chetrit N, Bakshi E, Zadok D, Tomkins O, Litvin G, Jacobson KA, Fishman S, Harpaz Z, Farbstein M, Yehuda SB, Silverman MH, Kerns WD, Bristol DR, Cohn I, Fishman P. Treatment of dry eye syndrome with orally administered CF101: data from a phase 2 clinical trial. Ophthalmology. 2010 Jul;117(7):1287-93. doi: 10.1016/j.ophtha.2009.11.029. Epub 2010 Mar 20.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablets q12 hours for 12 weeks

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablets q12 hours for 12 weeks

outcome.title: Schirmer Test (ST)
outcome.description: involved placing a standardized paper tear strip inside the lower eyelid for 5 minutes. The tear strip was then removed and the length of the strip that was wet from tears was measured in millimeters

outcome.title: Tear Break-Up Time
outcome.description: time elapsed between a complete blink and the development of the first random dry spot on the tear film

outcome.title: Fluorescein Staining of the Cornea
outcome.description: Severity of corneal epithelial loss as graded by Fluorescein Staining of the cornea, assessed on a 0-4+ scale with 0 = none and 4+ = severe de-epithelialization, expressed as number of participants with >25% improvement at Week 12 relative to baseline

group.title: CF101 1 mg BID
group.description: Oral tablets given every 12 hours for 12 weeks

group.title: Placebo BID
group.description: Oral tablets given every 12 hours for 12 weeks

measure.title: Fluorescein Staining of the Cornea
measure.description: Severity of corneal epithelial loss as graded by Fluorescein Staining of the cornea, assessed on a 0-4+ scale with 0 = none and 4+ = severe de-epithelialization, expressed as number of participants with >25% improvement at Week 12 relative to baseline

outcome.title: Proportion of Clinical Success
outcome.description: improvement of ≥25% over baseline at Week 12 in BUT, superficial punctate keratitis as assessed by FS, or ST

outcome.title: Dry Eye Symptom Score
outcome.description: consists of 12 questions designed to assess the symptoms of ocular irritations, covering three areas: ocular symptoms, environmental triggers and visionrelated function

outcome.title: Tear Meniscus (TM) Height
outcome.description: Indicator of tear volume. TM was recorded on a scale from 0-3, with 0=none, 1=trace, 2=normal, and 3=high.

outcome.title: Use of Artificial Tears
outcome.description: daily use of REFRESH TEARS® Lubricant Eye Drops artificial tears supplied to each patient was recorded in diaries provided to patients

reported_events.time_frame: Starting on week 2 till week 12 and continue till foloow up visit on week 14

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo tablets q12 hours for 12 weeks

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
